issue.title: Documentation claims filter patterns are applied to directories before recursing, this does not appear to be true

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Regarding filter rules, the rclone man page in 1.53.2 claims, "A similar process is done on directory entries before recursing into them. This only works on remotes which have a concept of directory (Eg local, google drive, onedrive, amazon drive) and not on bucket based remotes (eg s3, swift, google compute storage, b2)."

I believe this means that, e.g., if I have a local remote with some files in it named `.DS_Store`, and the same remote also has some directories in it named `@eaDir`, then I should be able to specify `--filter '- **/@eaDir' --filter '- **/.DS_Store'` to filter out all of those. That is not what happens, however. The files are filtered out but the directories are not. So either the man page is wrong, or the code is malfunctioning.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.50.2
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

See above.

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

I'm reproducing this issue with a local filesystem.

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
$ cd /tmp
$ mkdir test-dir
$ mkdir test-dir/subdir
$ mkdir test-dir/subdir/@eaDir
$ touch test-dir/subdir/@eaDir/unwanted-file
$ touch test-dir/subdir/.DS_Store
$ rclone ls --filter '- **/@eaDir' --filter '- **/.DS_Store' test-dir
        0 subdir/@eaDir/unwanted-file
$ 
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
$ rclone -vv ls --filter '- **/@eaDir' --filter '- **/.DS_Store' test-dir
2020/10/26 21:32:21 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.50.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "ls" "--filter" "- **/@eaDir" "--filter" "- **/.DS_Store" "test-dir"]
2020/10/26 21:32:21 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/jik/.rclone.conf"
2020/10/26 21:32:21 DEBUG : subdir/.DS_Store: Excluded
        0 subdir/@eaDir/unwanted-file
2020/10/26 21:32:21 DEBUG : 2 go routines active
2020/10/26 21:32:21 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.50.2" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "ls" "--filter" "- **/@eaDir" "--filter" "- **/.DS_Store" "test-dir"]
$ 
```

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

An attempt to make directory filter rules marginally less confusing inspired by reading 
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3375

I think the filter documentation is in step with that commit. The prior position when, with `ListR`, --exclude /foo/ did not have an equivalent effect to to --exclude /foo/** was not properly explained in the rewrite I did.

The three bullet points identifying when directory recursion optimisation is applied to the listing trouble me. The two prior attempts at putting the code logic into words were as bad. Maybe something closer go code logic should be incorporated?

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before.

No.
